intro: Bidens bonplandii, commonly known as the yellow fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant has rough, hairy leaves and produces small, white to yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flowers. Bidens bonplandii is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
